The novel "The Pianoplayers" was written by Anthony Burgess and was first published in 1986. It draws heavily on Burgess's memories of his father, who was a pub piano-player. The story is narrated by Ellen Henshaw, a prostitute who later becomes a madam, while her father, Billy, plays the piano in the cinema, accompanying silent movies.

Additionally, there are music albums with similar titles, such as "The Piano Player" by Ramsey Lewis, released in 1970, and "The Piano Player" by Maksim Mrvica, released in 2003. The author of the novel "The Pianoplayers" is Anthony Burgess.
